p: The enzyme-inhibitory capabilities of M. buxifolia extracts were assessed for five clinically important enzymes, which showed their significant potential (Table 5). The methanol extracts of both parts of the plant and the chloroform extract of stems were most active against AChE (4.70, 4.66, and 4.62 mg GALAE/g, respectively), while, for BChE, the chloroform extract of stems was most potent (4.27 mg GALAE/g). The stem extracts showed significant tyrosinase- (140.16 and 137.93 mg KAE/g inhibition by methanol and chloroform extracts, respectively) and amylase-inhibitory activities; however, all four extracts presented equal inhibition of glucosidase activity.
